meta.description: A modern, high-performance React starter template built with Vite, Tailwind CSS, and Shadcn UI. Features Static Site Generation (SSG) for optimal SEO and speed.
meta.keywords: react, vite, ssg, tailwind css, shadcn ui, starter template, typescript

og.title: React Vite SSG Starter - Build Faster
og.description: The ultimate starting point for your next React project. Production-ready, SEO-optimized, and packed with best practices.

hero.title: Build Modern Web Apps
hero.subtitle: Fast, Accessible, Production-Ready
hero.description: Kickstart your next project with this opinionated starter template. Powered by React, Vite, and Tailwind CSS. Pre-configured with SSG, i18n, and a beautiful UI component library.

features.title: Features
features.subtitle: Everything you need to build a modern web application.

items.title: Vite + React
items.description: Lightning-fast HMR and build performance with the latest React 18 features.

items.title: TypeScript
items.description: Built-in type safety for better developer experience and fewer runtime errors.

items.title: Tailwind CSS
items.description: Utility-first CSS framework for rapid UI development and easy customization.

about.title: Why Use This Starter?
content: Starting a new project often involves spending hours configuring build tools, linters, and libraries. This starter template aims to solve that problem by providing a solid foundation with sensible defaults.
We've verified that all tools work seamlessly together, so you can focus on building your product instead of fighting with configuration files.
Whether you're building a landing page, a dashboard, or a blog, this template scales with your needs.

gettingStarted.title: Getting Started
content: Clone the repository and run `pnpm install` to install dependencies.
Start the development server with `pnpm dev`.

items.question: Is this free to use?
items.answer: Yes, this template is completely open-source and free to use for both personal and commercial projects.

items.question: How do I deploy this?
items.answer: Since it uses SSG, you can deploy the `dist` folder to any static host like Vercel, Netlify, or GitHub Pages.

items.question: Can I switch to client-side rendering?
items.answer: Yes, simply remove the SSG configuration in `vite.config.ts` and use standard React Router.
